p: Saint Louis encephalitis virus was first isolated in 1933 during a major epidemic in St Louis, Missouri, USA. Currently, this virus is widespread in the Americas and has been detected from Canada to Argentina [27]. In Brazil, SLEV was first isolated in 1969 in the northern region from a pool of Sabethes belisarioi mosquitoes in Pará State [28] and was first isolated from a human sample in São Paulo in 2004 [27].
